nse_queries.observation: If the narrative mentions the sku count as 2.0 on page 23 but the Table/another section reflects 5.0 on page 26, kindly reconcile the factual contradiction and provide revised draft of the table along with confirmation that the same shall be updated in prospectus

On page no. 10 to 26, it is mentioned utilities for manufacturing. Kindly clarify by: (a) providing the source of power and water (State grid vs Captive vs Private supply); (b) detailing the dependency risk (₹ impact of 1-day outage as % of EBITDA); (c) confirming availability of requisite NOCs/permits for water extraction/discharge. Provide revised draft.

[Critical - Operational] Throughout the Chapter (specifically on Page 13), the disclosure details operational processes including "Foam Slicing," "Adhesive Tape Slitting," "Lamination," "Band Saw Cutting," "Foam Punching," "Final Inspection," "Packing," "Finished Goods (FG) Storage," "Pre-Dispatch Inspection," and "Transport." While these steps describe the manufacturing and dispatch process, they lack specific quantitative data regarding operational efficiency, defect rates, or adherence to quality standards beyond qualitative descriptions. Specifically, the disclosure mentions "inspection reports are filled out for each batch" and "Q-Alert visual standards are used for defect reference," but no data on the frequency or nature of defects identified, or the actual rejection rates against the total production volume, is provided. This absence of quantifiable quality metrics hinders a comprehensive assessment of operational hygiene and product quality control. Provide revised draft...

[Critical - Valuation] The "Total" revenue figures presented in the table on Page 3 (₹ 3,372.83 Lakhs for the three-month period ended June 30, 2025, ₹ 11,880.91 Lakhs for FY ended March 31, 2025, ₹ 10,219.18 Lakhs for FY ended March 31, 2024, and ₹ 9,240.20 Lakhs for FY ended March 31, 2023) do not precisely reconcile with the "Revenue from Operations" figures in the Key Performance Indicators table (₹ 3,372.83 Lakhs for the three-month period ended June 30, 2025, ₹ 11,880.91 Lakhs for FY ended March 31, 2025, ₹ 10,219.18 Lakhs for FY ended March 31, 2024, and ₹ 9,240.19 Lakhs for FY ended March 31, 2023). Specifically, the FY ended March 31, 2023, figure shows a discrepancy of ₹ 0.01 Lakhs. Confirm that the revised disclosure shall be updated in the Prospectus. Provide revised draft.
nse_queries.regulation_ref: ICDR Regulations - Disclosure Requirements for Financial Information

nse_queries.observation: [Critical - Operational] Throughout the Chapter (specifically on Page 169), the DRHP details the logistics mechanism for both procurement and product delivery, including the use of "own vehicles" and "third-party carriers." Provide a quantitative breakdown of the cost ratio between in-house logistics (own vehicles) and outsourced logistics (third-party carriers) for the last three financial years and the stub period ending December 2024. Provide revised draft...

[Critical - Operational] On Page 8, the DRHP states, "We have maintained long-term working relationships with several established brands across sectors." This implies customer retention and repeat business. However, specific quantitative data on customer churn rate and repeat business percentage for the last three financial years and the stub period ending December 2024 is not disclosed. Provide revised draft...

[Critical - Operational] Throughout the Chapter (specifically on Page 29), the disclosure of "QA Certifications vs Actual Inspection/Rejection rates" is absent. While insurance policies are listed, there is no information regarding quality assurance certifications held by the company or any data on actual inspection or rejection rates for the insured assets. Provide revised draft...

On page no. 15, it is mentioned CSR activities. Kindly confirm whether the allocated amount was expended and specify the quantum thereof for the past three fiscal years. Further, provide a revised draft along with confirmation that the same will be updated in prospectus

[Critical - Operational] The DRHP on Page 157 details the "Polyurethane (PU) Foam Moulding Process" with quality checks including "Visual Inspection", "Dimensional Accuracy", and "Final Inspection Pre-Dispatch". To assess operational hygiene and product quality, please provide the Company's QA certifications and contrast them with actual inspection/rejection rates for the last three financial years and the stub period ending December 2024. Provide revised draft...
nse_queries.regulation_ref: ICDR Regulations - Disclosure Requirements for Risk Factors

nse_queries.observation: On page no. 1, it is mentioned the disclosure regarding subsidiary rationale. Kindly clarify the rationale for the existing corporate structure and the reasons for not undertaking business operations directly through the Issuer Company. Further, provide a revised draft along with confirmation.

In “Our Business” chapter- It is observed that the Company has made use of superlative words / adjectives like the disclosure regarding superlative evidence etc. without citing the source and basis of the same as per the instructions mentioned in Schedule VI of the SEBI (ICDR) Regulations 2018 in relation to forward-looking statements. Kindly provide the source/basis of all such statements/claims. Also include these bases in the Material Documents Chapter available for inspection. If not, kindly review and revise the same. Further, the above mentioned points are merely indicative in nature, the Merchant banker shall vet the offer document and ensure that there are no disclosures which are advertising statements and marketing statement and if there are any it shall be either be drafted in a neutral language or provide a basis for the same or removed, to that end, kindly provide a draft along with a confirmation the same shall be placed at the time of prospectus as applicable
nse_queries.regulation_ref: ICDR Regulations, Schedule VI - Forward-Looking Statements

nse_queries.observation: On page no. 6, it is mentioned the disclosure regarding logistics mechanism audit. Kindly provide details pertaining to the logistics mechanism of the Company, including the ratio of in-house vs outsourced logistics. Further, provide a revised draft along with confirmation that the same will be updated in prospectus

On page no. 7, quality assurance processes are discussed. Kindly elaborate on the Company’s quality assurance and control mechanisms. If the Company lacks in-house quality certifications, kindly provide the rationale and consider the inclusion of a risk factor. Further, provide a revised draft along with confirmation.

On page no. 1, it is mentioned the disclosure regarding management experience individual. As per drafting norms, kindly provide individual years of experience, specific domain expertise, and prior successful track record for each Key Managerial Personnel (KMP). Avoid generic aggregation. Provide revised draft and confirmation.

[Critical - Operational] On Page 161, the "Inspection" section details checks for "Dimensions (thickness, length, and width) using Vernier callipers," "Material properties, such as density (using a weighing scale) and Shore A hardness (using a hardness tester)," and "Visual quality, ensuring there are no surface defects as per Customer-Specific Requirements (CSR)." However, the DRHP does not provide any data on the actual inspection results, such as rejection rates or the frequency of defects identified during these inspections. Provide historical data for the last three financial years and the stub period ending December 2024, detailing the percentage of rejected batches or units based on the outlined inspection criteria. Confirm that the revised disclosure shall be updated in the Prospectus. Provide revised draft.
nse_queries.regulation_ref: ICDR Regulations - Disclosure Requirements for Risk Factors
